parts.text: Develop an institutional trading platform with real-time market data feeds, advanced order management systems, comprehensive portfolio tracking, risk controls, regulatory compliance for equities and derivatives, and real-time P&L calculations

Thank you for the request. To get started, we need to set up the repository first. We follow a **GitOps practice**, which means the repo isn't just for code—it's the anchor for your entire project. Setting it up now ensures that every design choice and configuration we make next has a permanent home immediately.

Since we're building an institutional trading platform (real-time market data, advanced OMS, portfolio tracking, risk controls, regulatory compliance for equities & derivatives, and real-time P&L), the repo strategy we choose now will shape how we scaffold entities, workflows, and infra in the next Design → Build → Environment → Deploy steps.

I've popped up the options below for you. Please select the language (Python or Java), visibility (Public or Private), and whether to create a New Branch or use Your Existing Branch so I can proceed with the appropriate template and branch setup.
I want to build a trading platform

Thank you for the request. To get started, we need to set up the repository first. We follow a **GitOps practice**, which means the repo isn't just for code—it's the anchor for your entire project. Setting it up now ensures that every design choice and configuration we make next has a permanent home immediately.

We're building a trading platform, so choose the repository strategy that best matches your priorities for language and visibility. A quick note on language trade-offs: Python speeds up development and has excellent numerical and ML libraries (good for strategy development and prototyping), while Java can offer stronger type-safety and high-throughput production characteristics.

I've popped up the options below for you. Please select the repository strategy you'd like to use (language + public/private + new or existing branch), and I'll proceed with the appropriate initialization steps.
Generate a new app for inventory management

Thank you for the request. To get started, we need to set up the repository first. We follow a **GitOps practice**, which means the repo isn't just for code—it's the anchor for your entire project. Setting it up now ensures that every design choice and configuration we make next has a permanent home immediately.
What is a technical ID in Cyoda?
Let me explain.
How does event sourcing work?
Let me explain.
What are best practices for entity design?
Let me share guidelines.
Deploy my Cyoda environment to the cloud

- Status: **Awaiting environment selection** (selection UI shown).
- Next steps after you pick an environment:
  1. I will call check_environment_exists() and attach the cloud hook.
  2. If not present, I will deploy the environment (provisioning ~ **5–10 min**).
  3. After provisioning I will deploy any apps you request (app deploys ~ **3–5 min**), return the **Build ID**, and trigger a "View Status" hook.
- Note: I'll monitor the build and surface logs/errors. If auth issues appear I can issue technical credentials.

Please choose an environment from the UI (dev, staging, or prod).
I've built my app, how do I run it locally?

Great — I can help with that. Are you running a Python app or a Java app?

If you're not sure, check your project for these clues:
- Python: files like app.py, requirements.txt, or common/repository/cyoda/cyoda_init.py
- Java: files like .gradlew, build.gradle, or a src/main/java folder

Tell me which one and I'll give the exact step-by-step commands to run it locally.
Generate a workflow for order processing

Thank you for the request. To get started, we need to set up the repository first. We follow a **GitOps practice**, which means the repo isn't just for code—it's the anchor for your entire project. Setting it up now ensures that every design choice and configuration we make next has a permanent home immediately.

Since we're building an order processing workflow, I've popped up the repository and branch strategy options below for you. Please select one of the options in the picker and I'll proceed with the repository initialization and cloning.
I need to track customer orders, manage inventory levels, send notifications when stock is low, and generate daily reports

Thank you for the request. To get started, we need to set up the repository first. We follow a **GitOps practice**, which means the repo isn't just for code—it's the anchor for your entire project. Setting it up now ensures that every design choice and configuration we make next has a permanent home immediately.

I've popped up the options below for you.

Since we're building a system to track customer orders, manage inventory levels, send low-stock notifications, and generate daily reports, please choose the repository + language strategy that you want me to initialize (Python or Java, public or private, new branch or an existing branch). Once you pick, I'll initialize the repo using the standard Cyoda template and proceed to the Design (Canvas) phase.
